鮙鮙鮙

鮙字的基本解释

鮙
tǎ
同“鳎”。

鮙字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tǎ］
［《廣韻》吐盍切，入盍，透。］
亦作“鮙1”。“鳎1”的繁体字。
(1)即鲵。
(2)鱼类的一种。即鳎科比目鱼。体侧扁，呈片状，长椭圆形，像舌头，有细鳞。头部短小，有绒毛状的牙，两眼生在身体的右侧或左侧。侧卧在浅海底的泥沙上，捕食小鱼。常见的有条鳎和舌鳎。通称鳎目鱼。
[②]［dié］
亦作“鮙2”。同“鰈1”。“鳎2”的繁体字。

鮙字的康熙字典解释

【亥集中】【魚字部】　鮙； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页1468第23
【正字通】俗鰨字。

鮙字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体韩国明朝体
鮙字的起名意思

暂无。

Sing
Basic explanation of words
Sing
tǎ
Same as "sole".
Sing
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tǎ］
["Guangyun" cuts into the spit, enters the spit, and penetrates. ]
Also known as "鮙1". Traditional characters for "鳎1".
(1) The salamander.
(2) A kind of fish. That is the sole fish. The side of the body is flat, flaky, oblong, like a tongue, with fine scales. The head is short, with hairy teeth, and the eyes are on the right or left side of the body. Lying on the sand on the shallow seabed, prey on small fish. Common sole and tongue sole. Commonly known as sole fish.
[②]［dié］
Also known as "鮙2". Same as "齽1". Traditional characters for "鳎2".
Sing

[Hai Collection] [Fish Character Department] 　鮙; Kangxi Strokes: 17; Page Number: Page 1468 Page 23
【Zhengzitong】vulgar word for sole.
